ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some information on Poincaré and two errors he made: one that he corrected in the restricted three-body problem, his correction started the chaos theory, and his refuse of the Boltzmann's law.
There is no real mathematical content here, just some trivia about Gregori Perelman's proof.

X.T: Life, Death and the Monster - Numberphile

ARTICLE.COMMENT: John Conway speaks about his career.

X.T: The Brain of John Conway (and his Amazing Tongue) - Numberphile

ARTICLE.COMMENT: More Conway interview.

X.T: The Fields Medal (with Cédric Villani) - Numberphile

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Cédric Villani speaks about his Fields medal.
Cédric Villani tells about his (cluttered) office.
How Cédric Villani adapts his speech to his interlocutors.
Cédric Villani will not say why he is wearing a spider on his lapel.
I guess these are extracts from a longer interview.
Another interview.

X.T: Terry Tao and 'Cheating Strategically' (extra footage) - Numberphile

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The continuation of the previous video.

X.T: This Man Is About to Blow Up Mathematics
X.ST: Harvey Friedman is about to bring incompleteness and infinity out of quarantine.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Friedman tries to motivate mathematicians to take care about Gödel's incompleteness theorems.
Examples of theorems whose proofs unexpectingly require a more powerful axiomatic system that the one the theorems are express within.
